Description: A stuffed paratha from Mughlai cuisine, with a rich filling of minced meat, eggs, and spices, often pan-fried to a crisp golden brown.

Name: Telebhaja
Description: A popular Bengali street food, comprising various vegetables (like eggplant, potato, onion) coated in a gram flour batter and deep-fried.

Name: Achaar (Pickle)
Description: A spicy and tangy pickle, a staple Indian condiment made with fruits or vegetables preserved in oil and spices.

Name: Amla Pickle
Description: A pickle made from Indian gooseberry ('Amla'), known for its sour and tangy flavor and high Vitamin C content.

Name: Appalam
Description: A thin, crispy wafer made from lentil flour, similar to Papad, popular in South India. It can be roasted or deep-fried.

Name: Bellulli Chutney
Description: A pungent and spicy garlic ('Bellulli' in Kannada) chutney, often served with dosas and idlis in Karnataka.

Name: Boondi Raita
Description: A North Indian side dish made with yogurt and 'boondi' (small fried chickpea flour balls), spiced with roasted cumin powder.

Name: Chilli Pickle
Description: A spicy pickle made with green or red chilies, preserved in oil and spices. A fiery condiment for those who love heat.

Name: Chutneys (Coconut)
Description: A classic South Indian chutney made from fresh coconut, roasted chana dal, and spices, blended to a smooth paste.

Name: Chutneys (Coriander)
Description: A fresh and zesty chutney made with coriander leaves, green chilies, and a hint of lemon or tamarind, popular across India.

Name: Chutneys (Mint)
Description: A refreshing and tangy chutney made with mint leaves, green chilies, and a touch of lemon, often served with kebabs and snacks.

Name: Chutneys (Peanut)
Description: A nutty and slightly spicy chutney made from roasted peanuts, garlic, and spices. Popular in many parts of India, especially with dosas and idlis.

Name: Chutneys (Tamarind)
Description: A tangy and sweet chutney made from tamarind pulp, jaggery, and spices. It is a key ingredient in many chaat items.

Name: Chutneys (Tomato)
Description: A versatile and flavorful chutney made from ripe tomatoes, onions, garlic, and spices. It can be sweet, tangy, or spicy.

Name: Coconut Chutney
Description: A classic South Indian chutney made from fresh coconut, roasted chana dal, and spices, blended to a smooth paste.

Name: Coriander Chutney
Description: A fresh and zesty chutney made with coriander leaves, green chilies, and a hint of lemon or tamarind, popular across India.

Name: Cucumber Raita
Description: A refreshing side dish made with yogurt and grated cucumber, flavored with roasted cumin powder and a touch of salt.

Name: Cucumber Pachadi
Description: A refreshing South Indian side dish made with finely chopped cucumber mixed with yogurt and a tempering of mustard seeds and curry leaves.

Name: Dahi Vada
Description: A popular Indian snack where soft, spongy lentil fritters are soaked in creamy yogurt and topped with chutneys and spices.

Name: Dry Chutney Powders
Description: A variety of powdered chutneys made from roasted lentils, spices, and herbs, used as a dry condiment with idli, dosa, or rice.

Name: Gojju
Description: A sweet, spicy, and tangy curry-like accompaniment from Karnataka, made with tamarind and a variety of vegetables or fruits.

Name: Groundnut Chutney
Description: A nutty and slightly spicy chutney made from roasted groundnuts (peanuts), garlic, and spices. Popular in many parts of India.

Name: Gurellu Chutney Pudi
Description: A dry chutney powder from North Karnataka made from roasted niger seeds ('Gurellu'), lentils, and spices.

Name: Hurali Pudi
Description: A dry chutney powder from Karnataka made from roasted horse gram ('Hurali'), lentils, and spices.

Name: Ingi Curry
Description: A spicy and tangy curry-like accompaniment from Kerala, made with ginger ('Ingi'), tamarind, and jaggery.

Name: Kadalekalu Kootu
Description: A South Indian side dish from Karnataka, a mildly spiced lentil and chickpea curry ('Kadalekalu' means chickpeas) with coconut and spices.

Name: Kai Gojju
Description: A tangy and sweet accompaniment from Karnataka, made with unripe mango ('Kai') and spices, similar to a pickle but with a curry-like consistency.

Name: Kalu Palya
Description: A South Indian dry stir-fry dish from Karnataka made with different types of beans or lentils ('Kalu') and spices.

Name: Kandipodi
Description: A spicy and flavorful dry chutney powder from Andhra Pradesh, made from roasted toor dal (pigeon pea), spices, and red chilies.

Name: Kichadi
Description: A one-pot dish of rice and lentils, cooked with spices and vegetables. It is a wholesome, nutritious, and comforting meal.

Name: Kosambari
Description: A refreshing salad from Karnataka, made with soaked lentils, finely chopped vegetables, and a tempering of mustard seeds and curry leaves.

Name: Kootu
Description: A South Indian side dish made with a combination of lentils, vegetables, and coconut, a semi-solid dish with a mild flavor.

Name: Lime Pickle
Description: A tangy and spicy pickle made from small limes, preserved in a mixture of spices and oil.

Name: Maanga Curry
Description: A spicy and tangy curry from Kerala, made with unripe mango ('Maanga') cooked in a coconut-based gravy.

Name: Majjige Huli
Description: A traditional Karnataka side dish, a buttermilk-based sour curry ('Majjige' means buttermilk, 'Huli' means sour) with vegetables.

Name: Majjige Menasu
Description: A unique South Indian condiment of green chilies marinated in salted buttermilk and sun-dried, then deep-fried until crisp.

Name: Majjige Saaru
Description: A light and refreshing buttermilk-based soup from Karnataka, seasoned with spices and a tempering of mustard seeds and curry leaves.

Name: Mango Chutney (Raw)
Description: A tangy and spicy chutney made from raw, unripe mangoes, blended with spices, and sometimes a touch of jaggery.

Name: Mango Pickle
Description: A spicy and tangy pickle made from raw, unripe mangoes, preserved in a mixture of oil and a blend of traditional Indian spices.

Name: Mavina Kayi Uppinakayi
Description: The Kannada name for Mango Pickle ('Mavina Kayi' means unripe mango, 'Uppinakayi' means pickle), a spicy and tangy pickle made from raw mangoes.

Name: Menasina Kayi Uppinakayi
Description: The Kannada name for Chilli Pickle ('Menasina Kayi' means chilli, 'Uppinakayi' means pickle), a spicy condiment made with green or red chilies.

Name: Mixed Vegetable Kootu
Description: A South Indian lentil and mixed vegetable stew, typically made with a variety of vegetables and lentils like toor dal or moong dal. It's seasoned with a coconut-based paste and spices.

Name: Mixed Vegetable Pickle
Description: A spicy and tangy pickle made from a combination of different vegetables like carrots, cauliflower, and green beans. It is a popular condiment served with meals.

Name: Moru Kaachiyathu
Description: A traditional Kerala-style spiced buttermilk curry. It's a light and flavorful dish made with sour buttermilk, ginger, green chilies, and curry leaves, often served with rice.

Name: Mutta Thoran
Description: A Kerala-style egg scramble ('Mutta' means egg, 'Thoran' means stir-fry). It is a dry stir-fry made with scrambled eggs, grated coconut, and spices like mustard seeds, curry leaves, and green chilies.

Name: Nimbekayi Uppinakayi
Description: The Kannada name for Lemon Pickle ('Nimbekayi' means lemon, 'Uppinakayi' means pickle). A tangy and spicy condiment made with lemons, salt, and various spices.

Name: Onion Chutney
Description: A spicy and tangy chutney made primarily from onions, often blended with red chilies, tamarind, and other spices. It's a popular side dish for dosas and idlis.

Name: Onion Raita
Description: A refreshing yogurt-based side dish with finely chopped onions, green chilies, and coriander. It is often served with spicy biryanis or curries to cool the palate.

Name: Pachadi
Description: A traditional South Indian side dish, similar to raita or chutney, made with vegetables or fruits and yogurt. It can be sweet, sour, or spicy, depending on the ingredients.

Name: Palya
Description: A South Indian dry stir-fry ('Palya' in Kannada) made with a variety of vegetables, often seasoned with mustard seeds, curry leaves, and grated coconut.

Name: Pappula Podi
Description: A spicy and savory powder mix ('Podi') from Andhra Pradesh, made with roasted lentils and spices. It's typically mixed with ghee or oil and served with rice or idlis.

Name: Pudina Chutney
Description: A fresh and tangy chutney made from mint leaves ('Pudina'). It's a versatile condiment often served with snacks, kebabs, or as a side with main courses.

Name: Puli Inji
Description: A traditional Kerala-style sweet, sour, and spicy chutney made from tamarind ('Puli') and ginger ('Inji'). It is a staple at sadhyas (Kerala feasts).

Name: Pudi
Description: A generic term for a spiced powder mix ('Pudi' in Kannada) that is often served as a condiment with rice or breakfast dishes. It can be made from various ingredients like lentils, peanuts, and spices.

Name: Raita
Description: A popular Indian yogurt-based side dish. It is made with curd (dahi) and can include various vegetables, fruits, or spices. It's served to cool the palate alongside spicy dishes.

Name: Sabudana Happala
Description: A crunchy, deep-fried wafer ('Happala' or papad) made from sabudana (tapioca pearls). It's a popular snack or accompaniment, especially during fasting periods.

Name: Saaru
Description: A light, flavorful South Indian soup-like dish, similar to Rasam. It is made with lentils, tomatoes, tamarind, and various spices, often served with rice.

Name: Saggu

Name: Sambar

Name: Sharkara Varatti

Name: Shenga Chutney
Description: The Kannada name for Peanut Chutney ('Shenga' means peanut). A dry chutney powder or a paste made from roasted peanuts, garlic, red chilies, and other spices.

Description: A tangy, sweet, and spicy curry ('Gojju') made with sweet pumpkin ('Sihi Kumbalakai'). It is a staple in Kannada Brahmin cuisine.

Name: Tomato Chutney
Description: A versatile and flavorful chutney made from tomatoes. It can be prepared in various styles, from a simple fresh paste to a cooked, spicy, and tangy condiment.

Description: A cooling side dish made with yogurt and finely chopped or grated tomatoes. It is often seasoned with roasted cumin powder, salt, and a pinch of sugar.

Name: Urad Dal Pappadam
Description: A thin, crispy, and round wafer made from urad dal (black gram flour). It is deep-fried or roasted and served as a crunchy accompaniment to meals.

Name: Usli
Description: A South Indian dry preparation ('Usli' in Kannada) made from legumes like chickpeas or lentils, often seasoned with mustard seeds, curry leaves, and grated coconut. It's a light and healthy dish.

Name: Yennegayi Masala
Description: A spicy and flavorful curry ('Yennegayi' means stuffed brinjal) from Karnataka. Small eggplants are stuffed with a roasted peanut and spice masala and cooked in a tangy gravy.

Name: Zunka Vadi
Description: A traditional Maharashtrian dish made from chickpea flour ('besan') and spices. 'Zunka' is a dry stir-fry, and 'Vadi' is a fried patty or square.

Name: Allam Pachadi
Description: A spicy and tangy chutney ('Pachadi') from Andhra Pradesh and Telangana, made with fresh ginger ('Allam'), tamarind, jaggery, and red chilies.

Name: Gongura Pachadi
Description: A fiery and tangy chutney ('Pachadi') made from gongura (roselle leaves). It is a signature dish of Andhra Pradesh, known for its distinctive sour taste.

Name: Inji Thayir
Description: A traditional Kerala-style ginger and yogurt relish ('Inji' means ginger, 'Thayir' means yogurt). It is a tangy, spicy, and cooling accompaniment to meals.

Name: Raita (Boondi)
Description: A popular North Indian raita made with small, crispy fried chickpea flour balls ('Boondi'). It's a cooling side dish served with main courses.

Name: Raita (Mixed Veg)
Description: A refreshing yogurt-based side dish with a mix of finely chopped vegetables like cucumber, tomatoes, and onions. It's a classic accompaniment to rich curries and biryanis.

Name: Aloo Palya
Description: A dry stir-fry ('Palya') made with potatoes ('Aloo'). It is a staple side dish in South Indian cuisine, seasoned with mustard seeds, curry leaves, and turmeric.

Name: Arhar Dal Fry
Description: A simple and comforting lentil ('Dal') dish made from arhar dal (toor dal). It's tempered ('Fry') with spices like cumin seeds, garlic, and red chilies.

Name: Arhar Dal Tadka
Description: A popular Indian lentil dish where boiled arhar dal (toor dal) is seasoned with a tempering ('Tadka') of spices fried in ghee or oil, giving it a rich flavor.

Name: Bai

Name: Beans Palya

Name: Bembla Curry
Description: A dish from Northeast India, especially Mizoram, made with bamboo shoots ('Bembla' in Mizo). It is a simple, fermented bamboo shoot curry with a distinct sour and pungent flavor.

Name: Bendekayi Gojju
Description: A tangy and spicy curry ('Gojju') made with okra ('Bendekayi'). The okra is cooked in a tamarind-based gravy with a blend of spices, often having a slightly sweet flavor.

Name: Bendekayi Palya
Description: A simple and delicious dry stir-fry ('Palya') made with okra ('Bendekayi'). The okra is sauteed with spices, mustard seeds, and curry leaves until it is crisp.

Name: Beetroot Palya

Name: Chingudi Tarkari

Name: Crab Gassi

Name: Chepala Pulusu

Name: Chettinad Egg Curry
Description: A spicy and aromatic egg curry from the Chettinad region of Tamil Nadu. It is known for its intense flavor profile from a freshly ground blend of spices like star anise, cinnamon, and fennel seeds.

Name: Chingri Malai Curry
Description: A classic Bengali prawn curry ('Chingri') cooked in a creamy coconut milk ('Malai') gravy. It is a rich and mildly spiced dish, often served with steamed rice.

Name: Clams Sukka

Name: Curd Rice (Thayir Sadam)

Name: Gadde Palya

Name: Gasi

Name: Goode Huli

Description: A popular breakfast or dinner combination from Kerala. Idiyappam are steamed rice flour noodles, which are served with a sweet and creamy coconut milk gravy.

Name: Ragi Mudde with Soppu Saaru
Description: A traditional and healthy dish from Karnataka. 'Ragi Mudde' is a dense ball made from finger millet flour, and 'Soppu Saaru' is a tangy and spicy leafy-green soup.

Name: Khara Bath
Description: A spicy and savory breakfast dish from Karnataka, made with semolina ('rava'), vegetables, and a blend of spices. It is a hearty and flavorful dish.

Name: Kara Bhat

Name: Udupi Sambar
Description: A distinctive lentil and vegetable stew from the Udupi region of Karnataka. It is a slightly sweet and tangy sambar, known for its unique blend of spices and a hint of jaggery.

Name: Pesarattu with Upma

Name: Palakura Pappu

Name: Chingri Macher Malaikari
Description: A classic Bengali prawn curry ('Chingri') cooked in a creamy coconut milk ('Malai') gravy. It is a rich and mildly spiced dish, often served with steamed rice.

Name: Pabda Macher Jhol
Description: A light and flavorful Bengali fish curry ('Macher Jhol') made with Pabda fish. It is a simple curry with a delicate flavor from mustard oil and minimal spices.

Name: Muri Ghonto

Name: Santula

Name: Luker

Name: Pika Pila
